events.description: The European Central Bank held its first interest rate meeting of the year 2026, keeping rates unchanged.
Release of headline and core inflation data for the euro area for January.

facts.fact_text: Germany’s 10-year Bund yield fell to approximately 2.85%.

evidences.evidence_text: Germany’s 10-year Bund yield slipped to around 2.85%

facts.fact_text: The ECB maintained current interest rate levels.

evidences.evidence_text: the European Central Bank kept interest rates unchanged at its first policy meeting of 2026

facts.fact_text: Headline inflation in the euro area was 1.7% in January.

evidences.evidence_text: headline inflation slowed to 1.7% year on year in January

facts.fact_text: Core inflation reached 2.2% in January, its lowest since October 2021.

evidences.evidence_text: core inflation eased to 2.2%, slightly below forecasts and its weakest level since October 2021

claims.claim_text: Inflation is expected to reach the 2% target in the medium term.
claims.author: ECB

evidences.evidence_text: reaffirmed that inflation should converge toward its 2% target over the medium term

claims.claim_text: The economy of the euro area is showing resilience.
claims.author: ECB

evidences.evidence_text: The ECB said the euro area economy remains resilient

claims.claim_text: Trade policy and geopolitics are creating an uncertain economic outlook.
claims.author: ECB

evidences.evidence_text: warned that the outlook is clouded by global trade policy uncertainty and ongoing geopolitical tensions

claims.claim_text: A stronger euro might lead to discussions about cutting interest rates.
claims.author: some officials

evidences.evidence_text: some officials have cautioned that further euro appreciation could reopen the debate on rate cuts

evidence.evidence_text: German Bund Yield Eases as ECB Holds Rates
warned that the outlook is clouded by global trade policy uncertainty
further euro appreciation could reopen the debate on rate cuts
